Introduction to non-parametric models

Mar 2, 2024

Reading time: 1′


Non-parametric models are becoming more and more popular in Bayesian statistics, as they are able to accurately reproduce complex data and patterns. In this section we will introduce some of the most popular non-parametric models, namely splines and Dirichlet processes-related models.

When dealing with these models, one should keep in mind that the Bernstein-Von Mises theorem does not hold, so one cannot approximate frequentist confidence intervals with Bayesian credible intervals.


Stippe Mar 2, 2024
